page.title: 02ALVES VILLAGE NOW
page.content: Alves Village is a small, quiet and peaceful village apart from the A96 which runs along the side of it. The population of Alves is 148. There are a few amenities in Alves such as the playing park which has a football pitch. At the west end of the village is a garage which has a shop and a take away. There is also a pub called the Crook Inn. Eight new houses are planned for Alves and they are going to be built in Arbuthnott's yard.The Arbuthnotts sold the yard to the council. About 10 years ago the council bought forty acres of land from Moray Estates to build houses on but they haven't started yet.
